name: Ibis Praha Mala Strana

reviews.text: Ive been to prague last year and we stayed for 3 night at ibis hotel ! It was a great experience we went early september and yet the prices were sooo greatt!! It was a catch !! Dnt miss it !! The service is amazing so is the cleanliness and for such a low price!! the location isnt great though but it aint a big problem cauz the metro station is 200 metres away and 2-3 stations away from downtown !! I highly recommend this hotel and of course i highly recommend a vacation in prague its a piece of heaven!!
reviews.title: Great experience in a great city :D
very comfortable
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice before - in itself a recommendation. This hotel is superb within its own price range, with three-stop Metro access to the city centre. Highly recommended.

Stayed here as part of a package deal that made it dirt cheap (900 bucks for round-trip flight from Baltimore plus 7 nights) and have no serious complaints. If you are looking for luxury or scenic views this is not a good choice. If you are looking for a travel base by tram and metro lines that is clean and convenient, this is likely to work for you. The included breakfast might not be great by fancy hotel standards but it's waaay better than American-style "continental breakfast. Bring your own laptop and converter, unless you want to wait while drunk college students use facebook to flirt with each other on the two internet stations in the lobby. It's next to a mall with a Tesco and it was kind of cool to see daily, non-touristy city life in action, plus have access to an ATM, and some pretty decent espresso. There is also a Paul (french bakery chain) right nearby which is convenient for picking up snacks before a grand day out. If you can afford somewhere fancier and more central, go for it, because Prague is lovely and you want to spend as much time as possible exploring. But if you're on a budget you could do much worse.
reviews.title: Totally Servicable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Clean room. Staff helpful & friendly. Complimentary breakfast was generous. Close to grocery store in nearby mall.
reviews.title: Clean, Simple rooms, good services

reviews.text: Check-in was fast and friendly. Room was comfortable, with large bed, flat screen TV, free wifi, clean bathroom. Breakfast was not included and was 11 euros, it was a buffet and unless one was really hungry not worth the price. Staff was helpful and polite. There is also a safe available in the lobby area for your belongings. The lobby was comfortable and there is also a restaurant on site. Hotel is located just outside of the city centre and is located next to a large shopping mall. Public transportation is within one block, either tram or underground. Tram #9 will take you very close to old town, about a 15 minute ride. The hotel does seem to cater to tour groups, but at least the ones that were there while I staying were well mannered.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: This hotel has an excellent location providing you take public transportation as it is within 3 or 4 minute walk to the Metro, and even closer to various tram stops. Also location wise it is busy making it feel safe, and is right next to a massive shopping mall with a large food court.
reviews.title: great value

reviews.text: Check in was great, the person at the desk was more than pleasant and very helpful, her English was outstanding. The room is average European size for this price range hotel. The room was clean as was the bath. They do not however give any toiletries such as shampoo, that is in a dispenser on the wall.
reviews.title: Details

reviews.text: The breakfast was fine though there were a few glitches, once there was water in the orange juice dispenser, the glasses for the juice so small you had to go back frequently; but all in all it was fine. Various cold cuts, cheeses, pastries, coffee, tea, juice; all in all a good breakfast.
reviews.title: Good Hotel. Busy but good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative we had was that the room was too warm for us, air conditioning was not yet available (mid april) the only option to open the window which only opened a couple inches, but that was adequate; but let in a good amount of noise and we were not facing the street.
reviews.title: Great Location, Service, and Value

reviews.text: It's close to the public transport just steps away from the main bus and tram station.. Charles Bridge is just 15 min. walking distance from the hotel. Hotel is very clean and has a good car parking. Rooms are fairly big and comfortable. Besides breakfast was a feast.. I highly reccomend this hotel..
reviews.title: GOOD CHOICE FOR PRAGUE VISIT

reviews.text: This hotel is one of the cutest I've been to. First of all they have WiFi in the rooms, which is very important to me. Second of all the decor is very modern and nice. I found it was also well located as there is a mall right next door and a couple of restaurants around. But you need a car or would need to use the metro if you want to go to the city center (using the public transport system to and from the hotel and very easy). The rooms aren't very big (same for the bathroom) but there are really comfortable. As I was part of a tour and we've been to 2 other hotels, I can't estimate how much this hotel costs alone. But compared to the one in which we stayed right before, I was so happy to stay at Ibis. If I were to go back to Prague, I might consider staying there again.
reviews.title: Beautiful and comfortable

reviews.text: Rooms are small if you share as well as the bath, but it seems to be a good deal if you get a good rate. Smoking rooms smell very bad and worn out in general. It will be a good idea if they opened the windows when cleaning any room. Location is good vs the rate, although parking is NOT free in costs something around 20 Euros/per day which I think is high. You can park under the bridge or on the side street for free, it's just a matter on finding a spot and read the free parking sign, otherwise you could be parking on a reserve area/paying area and you will get a ticket. There are a great deal of restaurants around at a good price so that shouldn't be a problem, besides a big mall is next to the hotel. Service is great! I mean, they can't do miracles. I would recommend this hotel if you want to save some money or are in low budget, staying one or two nights, etc. At least you know what to expect.
reviews.title: Good choice if you know what to expect

reviews.text: The hotel is close to the main bus station to other cities in Czech Republic, easy to get along tram and metro. Hotel room is clean and with nice breakfast. Breakfast is great, with various choices of bread. Although it is a bit far away from the castle, it is reachable by tram and metro, a big supermarket nearby is an other advantage!
reviews.title: Great location and great value

reviews.text: The reception team was very helpful for all information and the location is very convenince for the traveller like me. it's near the tram no.20 , 12 that directly go to the important tourist attraction.
reviews.title: Good quality Save price!

reviews.text: My review is excellent ... It was an awesome experience ... The front desk people , the housekeeper, everybody was extremely helpful and nice .
reviews.title: Awesome hotel and employes

reviews.text: When I got there i was tired had a flight delayed , my luggage wasnt at the airport and neither my sister ... And Tomas the front desk person was extremely helpful
reviews.title: Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am definitely come back to this hotel
reviews.title: excellent service, good location, hot rooms

reviews.text: Very nice hotel, very close to every point of interest in Prague, with good prices and nice service.
reviews.title: New hotel old time Courtesy
Good Hotel
reviews.text: If you have troubles with the noise, then it might be problematic, since there is an emergency point near it and a lot of ambulances are crossing over - and the windows aren't sound proof (Or maybe it was a problem in my room, I don't know exactly)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Big breakfast with lots of tasty variety. Very helpful staff with good English. Very clean. Comfortable bed. Good shower with hot water. Although basic, it's got all the basics covered wonderfully.
reviews.title: Very good basic hotel

reviews.text: On the down side: Not much room in the room, and the only trash bin was a small one near the toilet.
reviews.title: Second time visitor

reviews.text: One of the best locations to stay in Prague! Andel metro station is just 3 mins walk away and there are loads of great restaurants and pubs (Zlaty Klas opposite) nearby. Also Novy Smichov shopping center literally next door with Tesco, many shops, cinema and places to eat. It's everything Ibis chain has to offer with some extra bonuses such as free highspeed WiFi in every room. The rooms are clean and renovated with LCD TV and nice bathroom. It's really best value for money with room prices starting from around 50 Euros per night on weekend! It's much cheaper than for example Ibis Old Town and offers the best service possible for a budget hotel. I've stayed in many Ibis hotels all around Europe (Poland, Czech Rep., Germany, France, UK etc.) and this might have been my best experience with Ibis chain so far!
reviews.title: Definitely recommend this Ibis in a lively Smihov district!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location for touring anywhere in Prague. Really convenient to metro and trams. Not far from airport. Good breakfast every day. Restaurant food also good. Right next to big mall with grocery superstore and boutiques and near really good restaurants and pastry shop.
reviews.title: CONVENIENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside is some rooms on back side of hotel are noisy from traffic and a delivery door that opens and closes all day/night and beeps every time it opens, plus trucks beep when they back up.
reviews.title: Great Location Lovely Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay here. rooms are clean and comfortable. Location is excellent - close to the metro to get into Prague City Centre, across from a large shopping centre with supermarket, cinemas (some movies were in English) and restaurants, and within walking distance down some streets and through a lovely park along the river up to the Prague Castle on the hill.
reviews.title: Pleasent stay in wonderful Praha

reviews.text: Would def stay here again if traveling to Prague.
reviews.title: Another Ibis, good as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've recently returned from our first visit to Prague staying at the Ibis Hotel, Mala Strana and were very impressed. This hotel is modern, clean and comfortable with excellent service and a good choice of food. It is also quiet, we had the best sleep and the air conditioning worked well!! There are some good shops nearby (Tesco, M&S, Next etc.) and the trams and metro are only 5 mins. walk away. The staff were very friendly and polite and helpful - we had arranged for a car to collect us from the hotel to take us to the river for an excursion and as it was late the receptionist rang the car company for us. We would certainly return to this hotel again.
reviews.title: Modern hotel situated close to all amenities, with excellent service and good food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed there for 4 nights with my wife, I picked this hotel for it's location, knowing that Ibis chain is all about a place to sleep, so not expecting more than a clean safe room, we were happy with the hotel. staff were friendly enough.
reviews.title: Good Budget Hotel, With Excellent Location

reviews.text: As for location, tram is right outside the hotel, and Andil metro station is a 5 minutes walk, there are banks beside the hotel, Mcdonalds and a shopping mall (nuovy smichov), where we used to have our breakfast in one of the cafes.
reviews.title: No more than a clean toilet

reviews.text: The surrounding area gets a bit creepy late at night, but no concern on safety what so ever
reviews.title: Excellent location & great breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On a tight budget? definitely stay there
reviews.title: Good value and convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in a great location, only a three minute walk from tram/metro station to the old town and castle area, would highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Rooms too hot
Excellent
reviews.text: Breakfast was a mix of continental and hot food although the hot food was not to my taste i did not go hungry as plenty cereal/yoghurts/toast and pastrys to enjoy, any one really fussy can visit the huge tesco supermarket which is located next door in the massive shopping centre, to buy their usual cerals ect.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are curtious and all speak english to a high standard we have no compal
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: Another Ibis, excellent as always and nice and new. In a quiet enough area with tram and metro links but only a 10-12 min walk to the river.
reviews.title: Nice hotel except for breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hey if your on a budget then this Ibis is perfect. Clean, good service & great value for money. Hotel is only 8 stops away by tram from the centre of Prague. Shopping Centre next door with a Tesco. Plenty of shops, bars & resturants in walking distance if you didn't wanna venture in2 centre all the time.
reviews.title: Prague on a Budget - can't go wrong with Ibis

reviews.text: The only tiny issue I had was hotel had 3 lifts but no stairs! This means if you time it wrong like I did once i.e a coach load of tourists arrive with suitcases ahhhhhh I had 2 wait almost 20 mins 2 use the lift 2 get 2 my room on the 6th floor.
reviews.title: Nice Room
ibis Praha Mala Strana
reviews.text: I would recommend hotel but in all honesty I would want 2 stay more in centre on my next visit as still don't know how you pay for trams in Prague tut tut

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean room and the air conditioning worked great in the summer. Close to public transportation and many shops and restaurants. Not very far from the city center. Free wireless internet and a nice breakfast in the morning. Also felt fairly safe and the staff at the front desk were helpful.
reviews.title: Good Chain Hotel

description: Ibis Praha Mala Strana is centrally located, close to the historical district of Mala Strana. Most attractions are within walking distance, e.g. Charles Bridge (20 mins away), Prague Castle and Old Town Square. Wenceslas Square is only 3 stops away by public transport. All 225 rooms have AC, TV, radio, hairdryer, free Wi-Fi connection, soundproof windows. 3 rooms for disabled guests available. Restaurant, bar, parking, 3 meeting rooms for up to 90 people.
